summary: This is an email exchange from March 1, 2019, between Stacie B. Harris of the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) and two supervisors from the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The SDNY supervisors are reaching out to connect regarding the Epstein investigation after Harris contacted a line AUSA in their unit.

persons.name: Stacie B. Harris
persons.role: Attorney, Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
persons.context: Email recipient and respondent; works at the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) and was contacted by SDNY supervisors regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: SDNY Public Corruption Unit supervisors reach out to ODAG
events.description: Two supervisors from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit email Stacie B. Harris at ODAG to introduce themselves and request a call regarding the Epstein investigation, after Harris contacted a line AUSA in their unit.

events.title: Scheduling call about Epstein investigation
events.description: Stacie B. Harris responds to the SDNY supervisors, offering availability for a phone call later that day to discuss the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) Public Corruption Unit was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of February/March 2019.
The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) was in communication with the SDNY regarding the Epstein investigation.
The email shows coordination between different parts of the Department of Justice (ODAG and a U.S. Attorney's Office) on the Epstein case.
The identities of the two SDNY Public Corruption Unit supervisors and the line AUSA are redacted in the document.
